reviews.review_msg: other then not learning much, the last assignment - 3&4 grades came less then 3 days before the final and the 3rd midterm came after the final was released. expect no feedback and no responses for your questions other then a yes or no if using online discussions with her

Compiler Design is the area of research for Apala Guha. Therefore, this course was really interesting and exciting. The process of writing compiler step-by-step was the most complicated part of the course however it was really useful. Also, I like her video lectures since they were always accessible and very informed.
Didn't learn too much, but the prof was nice and the grading was nice.
I got an A but I don't really understand databases to the degree that I should. What is even normalization?

i cant speak for 354 but she was really good at teaching 379 the test were very clear and you would pass them if you watched her online lectures which explained everything the assignments were more on the difficult side but her grading criteria for them is nice so try your best on them and youll get a good mark. overall highly recomended for 379
Best prof 2018

For Apala to receive so many bad reviews in only 4 months should be a big red flag for you. She puts minimal effort into her videos and in person lectures. Wastes 10 minutes going over material covered in online lectures. The unfortunate 80 people cant get our 4 months back, but we can help everyone else to avoid tanking their gpa and wasting time

Horrible online lectures that do not teach you what you need to know for assignments/tests. Horrible marking scheme for assignments, either get 15/15 on a problem or 0/15, even if code for the assignment was not entirely incorrect. Takes far too long to mark everything. Had to self learn everything in this course.
Take CMPT354 from her if you enjoy challenges.
BEST PROF EVEEEE
Skip the classes, study at home.

The grading criteria and rubrics for assignments were unclear and the grades were released too late so while I thought I was doing well at the assignments, my grades were terrible eventually and I could do nothing to improve them because a couple of days before the 3rd assignment deadline came, the 1st assignment grades were just released.

While her online lectures are an improvement over actually going to class in the first place, even those are slow and hard to concentrate on. In class, a time for review on material covered.. .in the online lects? She "listens" to students ask questions and then responds by talking about something different, and passes it to other students to answr

She is a professor with a really good knowledge of compiler design for CMPT 379, but she just doesn't have the background knowledge and experience for Databases, so that explains why she cannot teach the course well. If you have no choice but to take her class, it is possible to pass and end up with a decent grade, but don't expect to learn much.

An absolutely frustrating experience. Consistently late, answered students' questions with questions. In person lectures seemed unorganized, and she often ended early. The assignments lacked clarity. Video lectures were of poor quality. Asked for feedback and then blamed the students. Overall, just truly unprofessional.
Great prof :)

Video lectures were a great idea, if she did them properly. They were difficult to understand, and jumped all over the place. Any questions directed at her in class she would redirect them back to the class for another student to answer. Assignments were ambiguous and hard to follow with no examples. Please avoid.

Do not take CMPT354 with her, I REPEAT, DO NOT. You pretty much learn nothing from her. You will be better off just read and learn SQL by yourself on Tutorialpoints. or other online resources. Even though the exams are seemingly easy but the instructions and questions are usually confusing and not clear. Definitely avoid.
Confusing, unstructured lectures and assignments. Many questions are unclear and left for your to interpret as she does clearly state criteria. Answers your questions with questions.
She taught us literally nothing with those 10 minutes "video lectures". I feel like I am better dumping my tuition into the toilet than taking another course with her..

She has terrible "lecture videos" that is supposed to be your lecture notes. Out of 3 lectures per week, she hosted only 2 and skipped at least 3 lectures on top of ending the lecture early occasionally because "she has nothing else to say". Exams aren't difficult but the pure lack of content to study or learn from made writing exams hard.

A very Incompetent teacher. Asked the classroom after the mid-term if they had any issues regarding the exam. Numerous students mentioned valid claims to issues with the midterm. Every single time there was any form of criticism she would immediately blame the student. Assignments and exams were all over the place in terms of information &structure

Great teacher, just be sure to go to all the lectures. She sometimes gives questions during lecture for practice which you can answer using an app. I found that part to be helpful and engaging. If you are good with programming this may be a good choice for you. Assignments are worth around 40%, so make sure your program passes provided test cases.
ez gpa booster class when she gives you double extension
